enum class choose {
    earliest,
    latest
};
}}

The scoped enumeration {{tt|choose}} can be passed to certain member functions of {{lc|std::chrono::time_zone}} and {{lc|std::chrono::zoned_time}} to control how ambiguous or nonexistent local times should be resolved. Passing {{tt|choose::earliest}} causes the earlier time point to be returned, while passing {{tt|choose::latest}} causes the later time point to be returned. (For nonexistent local times, these two time points are identical.)

If a {{tt|choose}} is not passed and an ambiguous or nonexistent local time is encountered, a {{lc|std::chrono::ambiguous_local_time}} or {{lc|std::chrono::nonexistent_local_time}} exception (as applicable) will be thrown.
